TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SqlTrackingQueryOptions extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Contains properties that are used to constrain the set of objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
A SqlTrackingQueryOptions contains properties that are used to constrain the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned by the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method against the tracking data in a database used by the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingService>. Each <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> in the collection of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> must correspond to a workflow instance which has tracking data associated with it in the database that meets the conditions specified by the properties of the SqlTrackingQueryOptions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMaxDateTime%2A>|<xref:System.DateTime.MaxValue>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMinDateTime%2A>|<xref:System.DateTime.MinValue>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.TrackingDataItems%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Collections.Generic.List%601>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowType%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).|
These values specify that a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> should return a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> object for every workflow instance that has tracking data in the database.
## Examples The following example demonstrates creating an instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> class. This example is from the Workflow Monitor SDK sample. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#128](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/wf_snippets/snippets1.cs#128)]

Docs.summary: Resets the properties of the to their default values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMaxDateTime%2A>|<xref:System.DateTime.MaxValue>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMinDateTime%2A>|<xref:System.DateTime.MinValue>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.TrackingDataItems%2A>|An empty <xref:System.Collections.Generic.List%601>.| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowType%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).|
These values specify that a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> should return a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> object for every workflow instance that has tracking data in the database.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the upper limit of the time period that, together with <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, is used to constrain the set of objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the upper limit of the time period used for matching workflow instances with a status specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A>. The default is <xref:System.DateTime.MinValue?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> constrains the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to those workflow instances that have the <xref:System.Type> specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowType%2A>, that have the status specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A> during the period specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMinDateTime%2A> and StatusMaxDateTime, and that have extracted data that matches at least one of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItemValue> objects specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.TrackingDataItems%2A>.
The <xref:System.DateTime> value specified by StatusMaxDateTime is inclusive. For more information about how the status of a workflow instance is matched, see the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > If `WorkflowStatus` is set to null, then `StatusMaxDateTime` and `StatusMinDateTime` are ignored. All workflow instances will be returned when `GetWorkflows` is called.
## Examples The following example demonstrates setting the StatusMaxDateTime property. This example is from the Workflow Monitor SDK sample. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#128](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/wf_snippets/snippets1.cs#128)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a <xref:System.DateTime> that, together with <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, is used to constrain the set of objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the lower limit of the time period used for matching workflow instances with a status specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A>. The default is <xref:System.DateTime.MinValue?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> constrains the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to those workflow instances that have the <xref:System.Type> specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowType%2A>, that have the status specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A> during the period specified by StatusMinDateTime and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMaxDateTime%2A>, and that have extracted data that matches at least one of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItemValue> objects specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.TrackingDataItems%2A>.
The <xref:System.DateTime> value specified by StatusMinDateTime is inclusive. For more information about how the status of a workflow instance is matched, see the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > If `WorkflowStatus` is set to null, then `StatusMaxDateTime` and `StatusMinDateTime` are ignored. All workflow instances will be returned when `GetWorkflows` is called.
## Examples The following example demonstrates setting the StatusMinDateTime property. This example is from the Workflow Monitor SDK sample. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#128](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/wf_snippets/snippets1.cs#128)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of data extract values which are used to constrain the set of objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.Generic.List%601> of objects that contains specified values to be matched for data extracted from the workflow instance or a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> constrains the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to those workflow instances that have the <xref:System.Type> specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowType%2A>, that have the status specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A> during the period specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMinDateTime%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMaxDateTime%2A>, and that have extracted data that matches at least one of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItemValue> objects specified by TrackingDataItems.
<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingRecord.Body%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.Body%2A?displayProperty=fullName> can contain <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem> records that contain data that is extracted from the workflow. The TrackingDataItems property contains <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItemValue> objects that specify certain values for this extracted data. If the workflow instance meets the other criteria specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> and TrackingDataItems is not a null reference (`Nothing`), the extracted data stored in the database for a workflow instance must match one or more of the extracted data values specified by the TrackingDataItems property for a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> object to be returned for the workflow instance.
If TrackingDataItems is a null reference (`Nothing`), the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned will not be constrained by the values of the extracted data for any of the workflow instances in the database.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value that is used to constrain the set of objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: One of the values or null ( in Visual Basic). The default is null ().

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> constrains the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to those workflow instances that have the <xref:System.Type> specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowType%2A>, that have the status specified by WorkflowStatus during the period specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMinDateTime%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMaxDateTime%2A>, and that have extracted data that matches at least one of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItemValue> objects specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.TrackingDataItems%2A>.
A workflow instance is considered to have a status that matches WorkflowStatus if the last <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord> received for that workflow instance before or during the specified time period has its <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.TrackingWorkflowEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property set to a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent> value that maps to the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus?displayProperty=fullName> value specified by WorkflowStatus. Therefore, the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfile> for the workflow instance must have a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackPoint> that is configured for the appropriate <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent?displayProperty=fullName> value. Only <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent> values that have been sent in workflow tracking records can be matched. If no workflow tracking records have been sent for the workflow instance, the workflow instance is considered to have a status of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus?displayProperty=fullName>.
The following table shows the mapping between <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent> values and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus> values.
|TrackingWorkflowEvent value|WorkflowStatus value| |---------------------------------|--------------------------| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus>|
If WorkflowStatus is null (`Nothing`), the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned will not be constrained by status; in other words, a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> object will be returned for any workflow instance that matches the parameters specified by the other properties of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates setting the WorkflowStatus property. This example is from the Workflow Monitor SDK sample. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#128](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/wf_snippets/snippets1.cs#128)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the workflow instance <xref:System.Type> that is used to constrain the set of objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Type>. The default is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions> constrains the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned by a call to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to those workflow instances that have the <xref:System.Type> specified by WorkflowType, that have the status specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A> during the period specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMinDateTime%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMaxDateTime%2A>, and that have extracted data that matches at least one of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItemValue> objects specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.TrackingDataItems%2A>.
If WorkflowType is a null reference (`Nothing`), the set of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> objects returned will not be constrained by workflow <xref:System.Type>; in other words, a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> object will be returned for any workflow instance that matches the parameters specified by the other properties of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions>.
